intro: Pulsatilla reflexa, commonly known as the meadow anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed segments and produces follicles that contain numerous small, dark brown seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Pulsatilla reflexa is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
